subject: Celebration Time
header: Happy Idd to all the readers of the newsletter.

We should try to avoid all the negativities around us and focus on every little success stories. I know it is not easy but we shouldn't give up without a fight. Now a days social media platform plays vital role in spreading the news. So if you do come across any success story please do share with the community. It helps as morale booster.

I would like to specially mention two stories this week, Andrew Solomon survey result and the action taken and Dean proposed community dashboard. Kudos to Andrew and Dean for taking the initiative. Keep it up.
Enjoy the rest of the newsletter.

entries.title: Perl is part of Google's Season of Docs 2021
entries.author: jason_mcintosh
entries.text: Jason announced the good news that Perl is now part of GSOD 2021.

entries.title: The support developers need - survey results and actions taken

entries.title: Please delete your old releases from CPAN!

entries.text: Neil appeal to all CPAN module author to clean up their old releases from CPAN.

entries.text: Mark continued his blog series and this time he is talking about test plans.

entries.title: Complexity ramblings
entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Thank you Flavio for the detailed discussion on the subject.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 Amazon vouchers by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month from all the contributors during the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with couple of fun tasks "Represent Integer" and "Recreate Binary Tree". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 113

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Canonical Path" and "Climb Stairs" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 112

entries.author: aaron_smith
entries.text: Aaron's style of analysis is very interesting and makes even difficult task looks simple. Well done.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112

entries.author: abigail
entries.text: Abigail approach to Canonical Path task is simply elegant. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112: Canonical Path

entries.author: abigail
entries.text: Abigail took us to another journey whilst dealing with Climb Stairs task. It took more than one readings to get the logic.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112: Climb Stairs

entries.author: adam_russell
entries.text: Adam presented cute modularised solution to this week challenges. Nice work, keep it up.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge 112

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Arne shared Perl and Raku solutions both this week. Raku solution to the Canonical Path task is my favourite.
entries.title: Canonical Stairs with Raku and Perl

entries.author: colin_crain
entries.text: Colin's dealing with the Climb Stairs task is very interesting. Loved his task analysis.
entries.title: After Finding Our Bearings: One, Two and Up We Go!

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Dave's used the power of regex when dealing with canonical Path task.
entries.title: One Step Beyond: Perl Weekly Challenge #112

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Flavio presented a very concise regex solution to the Canonical Path task. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: PWC112 - Canonical Path

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Flavio shared very interesting story and unique algorithm. Well done. Keep it up.
entries.title: PWC112 - Climb Stairs

entries.author: james_smith
entries.text: James is unbeatable when it comes to performance analysis. What an honour to have him in the team.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge #112

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Laurent shared something new try-steps for the Climb Stairs. Thanks for shairing the magic of Raku.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112: Canonical Path and Climb Stairs

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: Luis use of regex is very different from others. You must take a look.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112

entries.author: luca_ferrari
entries.text: Luca attempted to solve the Climb Stairs task without the use of any library, pure logical solution.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112: Climbing the canonical path!

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: Roger shared simple but concise solution to the Canonical Path task.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 112: Canonical Stairs

entries.author: simon_green
entries.text: Simon approached the Climb Stairs task in a very fun way. Loved it.
entries.title: Weekly Challenge 112

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
